intro: Spiesia mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs, giving it a soft texture. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields. Spiesia mollis is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
